Comment: My god the whining in here.  You‚Äôve spent $80 for an entire year of service that includes the ability to play multiplayer games.  Do you play COD, Battlefield, FIFA, Madden, GT7 or other online games with friends?  What is that worth to you?  Let‚Äôs assume that‚Äôs worth $3/month, so $36.  So now for $44, you get 36 free games (3 per month).  You are paying less than $2 per game and included throughout the year there were definitely some great games given.   Even if you only liked 5 games the entire year, it‚Äôs still less than $10 per game.  Some people are just never happy.  If you don‚Äôt like, save your money, don‚Äôt play multiplayer and buy only the games you are interested in when they are full price or go on sale.  I‚Äôm sure you‚Äôll complain about how unfair that is too. And yes, my other account is PS Plus but I post with this one.

Comment: I don‚Äôt know what the others are saying but I‚Äôve literally been waiting all year for Gotham Knights to hit the catalog. I was this close to buying it but held off assuming it would be ‚Äúthe next month‚Äù or ‚Äúthe month after‚Äù. Unlike Calisto Protocol‚Äôs special situation, I can assume that most games (1st party or not), have to wait a year before hitting the catalog. I‚Äôll remember that for the future, because Gotham Knights seriously needed a boost all year. My friends loved the game but with Suicide Squad so close, and storage space tight (thanks for the 667 gb btw‚Ä¶.), I really didn‚Äôt want to buy it when I have so many other games to play or work on. Yeah, I‚Äôm holding out for the mid-gen PS5 next fall. I refuse to buy more storage until then. Lots of other great spooky titles too, I put off Alien Isolation for almost a decade after not picking it up on Black Friday in 2015 (bought a bunch of games that I still never finished to this day). Also I was excited for Tekken 6 except I quickly realized it‚Äôs just the PSP port probably. I rented the PS3 game from blockbuster and loved it back in the day but never ended up buying it unfortunately. I wish I did. It always kind of haunted me. Like seriously, is this supposed to be the latest gen console or an overpriced, cheaply made Atari emulator with an absurdly small drive space practically designed to barely hold one single current gen game. Oh and shall we also discuss how you refuse to refund purchases of games that you‚Äôre still selling that aren‚Äôt (and never will be) complete due to the companies that made them going bankrupt? Or maybe how the (shady) primary necessity for your $120+ Edge controllers is because you deliberately made your default controllers to experience stick drift, etc so gamers have to choose to keep replacing the $75 default ones constantly or to buy a $125+ Edge one and still have to pay $20 per ONE SINGLE analog stick replacements, when they‚Äôll eventually wear out as well. Or maybe even perhaps the mind-bogglingly absurd decision to charge $60 just to change the color of the oversized plastic console plates that are worth $20 at best. Or maybe you‚Äôd prefer to have a laugh over how you had the audacity to charge $100 for that cheaply made ‚ÄúBackbone‚Äù (that Nintendo did better with its HandyBoy in the ‚Äô90s). And all this while charging $70-75 per game on top of an already $500 console? And do we really even need to mention how badly you dropped the ball by letting Xbox snatch up most of the greatest game publishing companies? Like seriously, what cards do you hold at this point to justify such a steep PS Plus price hike? Not a single one. You‚Äôre trying to go all-in on a bluff meanwhile everyone knows you have nothing in your hand but big talk, straight up lies, poor choices and cheaply made accessories but go ahead, by all means push your already overcharged and under-appreciated PS gamers over to Xbox even faster. Ya might wanna can whoever is making these ridiculous decisions. Cause if we didn‚Äôt know better (or at least assume better), one would almost suspect someones trying to fund a really bad üëÉüç¨ habit with even more bad decisions rather than trying to elevate what was once a gaming industry juggernaut to a whole new level, better than ever before. Between you and TakeTwo/Rockstar making some of the worst choices I‚Äôve ever seen companies make‚Ä¶at this point, I‚Äôm starting to think you‚Äôre both actually trying (and succeeding) to sink your companies, once and for all. I‚Äôve never seen two companies so visciously compete to try to crap all over the very same fanbase that made you, with such blatant highway robbery. Just shameful.

Comment: ‚ÄúFirst off, we have very exciting news for PlayStation Plus Premium members. We‚Äôre currently testing cloud streaming for supported PS5 games ‚Äì this includes PS5 titles from the PlayStation Plus Game Catalog and Game Trials, as well as supported digital PS5 titles that players own. When this feature launches, cloud game streaming for supported PS5 titles will be available for  use directly on your PS5 console. Author: CommandingTiger
Comment: Hey PS. What are you thinking about this new ‚ÄúQ Lite‚Äù handheld system? If it‚Äôs just going to be a remote play device, just put out remote play on more Android devices and the Vita and call it a day. Either way, you need to port Remote play on PS5, the PS Vita can remote play the PS4 and there‚Äôs no reason to do the same with the PS5.If it‚Äôs remote play only, then it‚Äôs DOA. It needs full PS4 and PS5 compatibility/emulation but at a lower performance. I don‚Äôt think you heard me correctly. That system only made sense as a ‚ÄúPremium‚Äù controller with Remote Play ability with s bigger battery.That controller would add additional features and functions inside each PS5 exclusive games like inventory management, additional buttons actions, scope shooting zoom in vision for shooters, puzzle solving, RTS ‚ÄúStrategy games‚Äù selecting troops, etc. It would be better than just a touch pad It would require software and hardware to save on battery greatly, keep the screen off most of the time for a better battery efficiency and a much bigger battery. This system only makes sense in a hybrid Handheld/Home console system. Where instead of ‚Äúremoving the joycons‚Äù, it keeps all of it‚Äôs component, but removes the main system console chip, while keeping the little sister system for smaller tasks and functions. The main system would also have it‚Äôs own dock that would connect to the TV as well as connection itself to additional SSD memory and Blu Ray drive. You can make a Ryzen console with 16Gb of Ram similar to a mobile device like the Asus ROG Ally handheld with more power than the Steam Deck that would rival and surpass the Xbox Series S (since it has more Ram) meaning it would make it easy for third party games to port the game over that if it‚Äôs on Xbox Series S, then it has to release on this handheld system. With Ryzen architecture, it makes it significantly easier to port the games over to the handheld. You would just scale down on this handheld for 1080p, 30fps to 60fps. If you can run Horizon Zero Dawn on the Steam Deck, you can run Forbidden West on a stronger Handheld.It‚Äôs not like with the Vita using an outdated ARM mobile chip with low Ram like the PS3. The architecture is significantly too different and under-powered. This ‚ÄúQ Lite‚Äù would have a dock behind the console to sit the main console board. You‚Äôre still releasing PS4 games and handhelds are now much stronger than a PS4 now. It would also feature Blue-tooth to connect to a PS5 or the handheld in dock mode. If you are just releasing this system as a remote play only controller, then there is 0 appeal and would be a waste of money for everyone, don‚Äôt waste your money.People can already remote play on their phone and that‚Äôs fine enough.The way it‚Äôs being described, I‚Äôd have to says that it is DOA and won‚Äôt sell well. You need the whole package.You need to be able to play your PS5 games on the go (and PS4) while lower specs obviously. It still needs 16Gb of Ram to avoid any memory issues like TLOU P! on PC.Easy to port, mass appeal in Japan. People want a real handheld and it won‚Äôt affect the PS5‚Äôs graphics at all, just the resolution and fps. It won‚Äôt be having dedicated studios making handheld only games, but rather a handheld that emulates all PS4 and runs PS5 games. There‚Äôs way too many handheld consoles to miss out on the growing market. Also use SD, USB memory, M.2 SSD or traditional type of memory. NO SONY OWNED MEMORY CARDS! They‚Äôre too expensive and don‚Äôt protect games.Blu-Ray games will need to be scanned once every 4 months or accessed via your PS5 from home to confirm you own that game for disc games.Your efforts to port games on this handheld will be significantly easier than those to port PS5 games to the wide array of PCs running on Windows with DX12.Be smart and it‚Äôll be a success. The ‚ÄúQ Lite‚Äù must have an OLED with Sony back HDR color calibration options for the screen.It needs replaceable battery similar to the PSP for longevity. By all means, don‚Äôt just send this as a controller with a screen, have it be a hybrid device console that plays PS4/PS5 games and run PS4 games as a PS4 pro mode. If the Q Lite also has an ARM chip, for whatever reason, then it should play PSP/Vita games too. If that‚Äôs the case. Remote play don‚Äôt always connect as most jobs and public areas legit block access to do so. So it would be absolutely pointless to release this without making it a console as well.

Author: Stonesthrow
Comment: Good question! I buy most games I‚Äôm slightly interested in and prefer physical for preservation. My favorites were Puppeteer, Plague Tale and Control because I didn‚Äôt get around to getting them, and also didn‚Äôt really mind not owning them permanently on disc. On top of that none of them had large download sizes, a major factor for me so as to avoid lag (I still don‚Äôt get why they‚Äôd want to combine online access with a service that has you downloading games regularly and ruining your bandwidth..). My second favorites were games I decided to give a try and really enjoyed. Mercenary Kings, 2064 Read Only Memories, Concrete Genie, Man Eater and Horizon Chase Turbo. That‚Äôs about it for my list of 253 PS+ games that I added (sub since it‚Äôs mandatory for online, so since PS4), other than a handful of small games I tried and deleted right after (but still earning a trophy or two so they‚Äôre permanently on my trophy list, discouraging me from trying PS+ games even more) and a few AAA games I‚Äôm still holding off of that get pushed back due to size.My comment was perhaps too harsh in that moment of disappointment (wish we still had an edit function) and I do  believe the selections have gotten slightly better since the new tiers got introduced (contrary to my beliefs, let‚Äôs hope it stays that way) and I realize I‚Äôm hard to please :) Objectively I think this is a great line-up.

Author: nop-cports
Comment: I bought the Collectors Edition of Horizon FW at launch and now it‚Äôs already turning up on PS Plus Extra???? Does anyone else find this insulting? Game prices are 80 euro minimum, people paying this much deserve 3years MINIMUM before it goes to subscription AND 5+ years before it goes to PC. The PC ports have NOT been doing well and teh subscriptions will not grow much more, you are essentially at a ceiling‚Ä¶.. you are also in a loop where you wont grow console sales much because you put exclusives on PC and therefore you cannot increase the roof on subscriptions. So youve really hurt yourselves with this one‚Ä¶you‚Äôll only see marginal growth. The other issue is that you cannot model for this in excel spreadsheets, so analysts have limited value. You can only model a relatively linear question in isolation‚Ä¶. not something as complicated as console growth / health when so many differing factors / inputs have to be considered. My advice is to treat PC the same as you treat XBox, it is an competing / alternative platform that is a threat to your platform.

The Evil Dead: The Game on PS4, PS5 is a cool game, as I‚Äôve tried it. It got decent metacritic ratings.  Since it‚Äôs in a crowded kill the zombies type of game. It‚Äôll need to stand out to get some playing time, as I have the Last of Us 1 and 2, Dead Rising 1 and 2, Dying Light 2, World War Z, and Back 4 Blood,  for example.  So I‚Äôm unsure how much play this‚Äôll get but it‚Äôs a good psn selection, as it‚Äôs worth trying. I‚Äôm looking forward to OlliOlliWorld on PS4, PS5. This is another good psn selection, as I‚Äôve otherwise wouldn‚Äôt have picked it up.  As a former skater, I love the skater games like Tony Hawk and Skater XL. OlliOlli is not a skateboard simulator but it still looks like a blast and it received good ratings on metacritic. Destiny 2: Beyond Light on PS4, PS5. I‚Äôve had several games from this series but I fell off playing this after Foresaken so this provides an opportunity to play this solid well done title again. Mafia: The Definitive Edition on PS4. Author: treos100
Comment: Fallout 76‚Ä¶from the fallout wiki (consider this a USER BEWARE): Fast traveling to anywhere at the exact time another player joins the fast traveling player‚Äôs public team can cause the game to freeze after showing a second loading slide, then freezing at the Vault-Tec auto-save screen. Disconnecting and trying to rejoin the team or waiting to join a new server cannot fix this. Solution: Sign in as another of your player characters, log out immediately, and try the bugged character again, even after waiting a few minutes. This fixes the problem. Trying to load up a character after putting the PS4 in Rest Mode for some time can result in the game crashing due to corrupt application data. Solution: Follow the on-screen suggestion, delete the application data, and reinstall it from the disc. Be advised, doing so also carries the penalty of losing all photos in the Photo Gallery, removing pre-set NW Favorites for weapon paints and clothing, selected loot bag, and dealing with the hassle of updating the game to the latest version again. Warning: If this happens more than once, it might be that the disc has become damaged, rendering the installation data corrupt so it only works for a short while before needing to be reinstalled again. The only solution is to buy a new copy of the physical disc, or attempt to download the data from online if the game was bought online instead, without the physical disc. Fast traveling or walking towards locations such as Kiddie Corner Cabins or Poseidon Energy Plant yard from certain angles can cause the game to crash. Reloading at the spawn point after restarting the game resets the bug for some time before it can happen again. If the game crashes while in the middle of a Daily Op, be it having just joined it, working it, or finishing it, but not having left it yet, or freezes during the auto-save screen with the Vault-Tec logo in the lower right corner, forcing a player to quit and restart the game application to undo it, it causes the frame rate when using the inventory HUD for anything, stash boxes, vendors, Legendary exchange machine, etc., to lag considerably, causing slow response from the game for any actions done with the DualShock 4 controller for several seconds. Solution: The lag clears up, but it takes some time, and can take several days before things return to normal and the frame rate recovers to more favorable levels, at least until the bug happens again to cause the player more frustration and grief. ‚Äî i ignored this game when you added it to ps+ extra and i am not going to download it now because i do not want a bethesda game that modders cannot fix FOR bethesda! and that is a FACT: modders are the bug testers/fixers of bethesda games, NOT bethesda themselves!

Author: treos100
Comment: can we please get an ISO of the ps1 game, Legend of Legaia for ps+ classic, please? i say ISO because none of the games currently listed in the ps+ classics section are ports as some have wrongfully stated in comments here in the past. they are emulated ISO files (almost certainly) sourced from ROM sites being run using an emulator sony made (or, iirc, took without permission if they‚Äôre being emulated like the ps1 mini console). and that‚Äôs very likely why they‚Äôre added so little of the ps1, ps2, ps3, and psp libraries to that part of ps+. they have to do all the emulator dev and testing work to get their emulator to successfully run the games with (HOPEFULLY, no guarantee) no major issues.

Author: treos100
Comment: that‚Äôs also why, if you buy a copy of any of those games normally via the psn store menu, the file size is bloated. these companies use bloatware emulation software. it‚Äôs janky and has never been as good as the free kind that predates them by a few decades. this whole selling ROMs and ISOs thing is a recent development. personally, i don‚Äôt think they should be doing that at all but i seriously doubt younger gamers give a f about the video games industry‚Äôs history of warring against video game preservation for decades. only to NOW be doing the exact thing they‚Äôve sued people for many times in the past. but know this, it‚Äôs thanks entirely to ROM websites that we‚Äôre getting ps+ classic at all. NOT sony. without ROM sites helping to preserve these games we might not have them at all right now. cause‚Ä¶well, need i remind you all of the infamous final fantasy VIII remaster where square had to literally salvage their own game code from an ISO file from a ROM website?

Hours and hours of gameplay. Personally, in my case, I was lucky to have the mains economically to be able to purchase some of these titles already, however there are awesome games for those who haven‚Äôt had the chance to purchase them. I have PS Plus Premium (because I had PS Now and PS Plus previously), and I am thinking to renew it next year, because I can play streaming those games I could not purchase in the past. I use the subscription, it is worthy for me. But if you think it is not for you, simply, do not buy it. I am PSPlus subscriber from day 1, then I stopped my subscription years later because I simply did not like the monthly games line up for several months. Simple. At the moment, for me, the PS Plus game catalog is absolutely fantastic; I am 45 years old, 25 years gamer, and in my opinion, at this time, it is my best time enjoying games with PS plus. And I would like to add, that I have had Game Pass Ultimate too, but I stopped my subscription: I can‚Äôt stop playing with my awesome PS5.

Author: xDD90x
Comment: It‚Äôs always great to gain insight from Mr. Yoshida. It‚Äôs just a shame that several of the games he listed are PS3 titles that can only be played via streaming, which is a sub-par experience even at its best. And I‚Äôm sure there were other titles he was forced to omit because they‚Äôre simply not available on PS5. I understand that emulation is very complicated, but the massive and beloved PS2 and PS3 catalogs are mostly absent and it leaves a great void on the modern PlayStation platform. For one, PS2 emulation should be a lot better than it is. During the PS3 era, Sony released many remastered collections of the best PS2 titles, which are still the definitive versions today. To a lesser extent, we saw a similar effort for PS3 games on PS4, but there is still so much missing. I think it would be a great success if PS could renew this program and remaster (not remake) SIE‚Äôs acclaimed PS3 games, including the aforementioned PS2 collections. I would actually prefer this over emulation and would buy the games again. Streaming from remote PS3 servers just doesn‚Äôt cut it and isn‚Äôt sustainable. Not to mention that in the era of 60fps performance, games running at sub-30 are difficult to tolerate. Also, PS3s and Dualshock 3s are failing, so we will soon have no way to access that incredible library. Resistance, Killzone, Infamous, Motorstorm, Ratchet, Sly Cooper, God of War, MGS4 (Konami)‚Ä¶ Please bring them forward.

Author: Skeetlejuice
Comment: They listen to how we buy or don‚Äôt buy, en mass, like any corporation. If people all dropped premium they would do something, but you cannot cancel early, as memberships are prepaid, and if you call in they will not give partial refunds past 2 weeks of purchase, and even then it‚Äôs not really their policy. Just do the tactic of sub for a month and binge, like on streaming services. This is the way to extract more value with less risk. You lose on plus or game pass for value as one month or 3 is worse terms, but the one month can have great value. When my son was off school and they added stray a game we were willing to buy anyways we took a month of extra, then in the last 5 days i upgrade to premium to test the now stuff and a few other games. If you don‚Äôt absolutely ‚Äúneed‚Äù the ransomed online it‚Äôs easy to live without plus and just buy games on sale etc. That‚Äôs what i do. Outside of black friday or boxing week (canada) plus deal i won‚Äôt reup such as the service is, and all the games were front loaded this summer anyways. They have been adding decent content for it monthly all the dragon quest stuff this month and i believe it is what they are lasered on. Extra is great value, Premium lacks true classics atm but both are still fair. Rn Premium might not be the best option for most and that‚Äôs why it‚Äôs not a primary tier but clearly it will build over time. Sony needs to add more classics but as early adopters ppl should realize the $1.80 (extra per month on yearly) tier will probably take time to build a classics/trials lineup. In some ways Sony has been for the players going back to PS4 launch and in others they haven‚Äôt. Helping push xb away from drm,great games, free vr titles, overall lack of mtx, covid initiative games, strong ps+ essential lineups after extra launched (see GwG), supporting VR, free dlc (Days Gone, Returnal, Tsushima, GT, Gravity Rush, Dreams, Destruction AS, Firewall, Farpoint, B&T, Concrete Genie, KZ), stellar next gen support (RTX, 3D audio, Dualsense), PS5 Digital 399 launch price, internal batteries, non proprietary ssd expansion. Yet $70 games, GT7 mtx, European ps5 price increase have been the opposite. Just be real.

Author: CommandingTiger
Comment: It seems like the Deluxe and Premium tiers seems a bit lacking in PSP, PS1 and PS2 games.You should maybe get more of these titles. Here‚Äôs my main question I have with Premium, why isn‚Äôt it a priority if it‚Äôs the highest tier? I‚Äôm sure they‚Äôll be plenty more games down the line, in a few years, but isn‚Äôt it in PlayStation best interest to want fans to upgrade to the highest tier? Wouldn‚Äôt you benefit from a higher cash flow. Now in my opinion, Classics should have been a ‚ÄúLite‚Äù tier as a basic tier because it absolutely makes zero sense to pay more to play older games that honestly can be emulated in some capacity, but people want to play it officially natively on a PS console, not streaming. I love the games getting into Essential and Extra tier, but the Ultimate tier should have been something more. I got a feeling like you are purposefully tricky down games in a monthly basis because of the limited amount of games that you‚Äôll eventually run out later down the down and people may not be as interested to play them if they can play them all today. However on the flip side, the lack of games significantly reduces the potential upgrade to the highest tier possible if there aren‚Äôt like 100s more games to start things off with. You‚Äôre going to have to find a way to make the Ultimate tier more appealing, balance releases for the tier and get a bunch more titles people are interested in. RE2? Dino Crisis? Soul Calibur Broken Destiny?The Legend of Dragoon?It‚Äôs not that hard to find games in your back catalog.You can easily get all Motorstorn games, all Resistance games, all Killzone games on the service.

Author: grapetrap
Comment: After 6 entries into the series as a button-mashing fighter-style game, it was nice that they changed up the combat system for Like a Dragon.  As the article explains, the combat style fits with the lore of the game, as Ichiban is a big fan of the Dragon Quest series.  It just makes sense that in his imagination, when he fights, it would be like this. We are always looking for the studios to change up the stale old way they present games but then when they do we complain they changed it up.  The combat may not be perfect or even as good as other similar systems in other games, But it fits this situation and added a fresh new game system to the Yakuza series. Of course, if the game had Kiryu as the main protagonist then the combat would be wrong‚Ä¶ Try out the Judgment series if you haven‚Äôt already. Those games are more like the old-school Yakuza games but with a new perspective on the districts.
